III.	Facility Identification
The Rana Meal Solutions, LLC facility is located at 1370 Brewster Creek Boulevard in Bartlett, Illinois.  The facility is a producer of specialty pastas and sauces.  

The NAICS code for the facility is 311991.  Many areas of the plant are refrigerated to freeze and preserve ingredients and products.   

The facility uses ammonia for refrigeration, and is regulated under 40 CFR Part 68, the EPA RMP Rule. There is one (1) refrigeration system onsite that is used for freezing and refrigerating ingredients, process areas, and products. 

The ammonia system inventory is approximately 20,000 pounds.  The refrigeration system is used to cool product in spiral freezers and glycol for use in building evaporator.  This refrigeration system contains the following equipment: (2) Low Temperature Compressors, (2) High Temperature Compressors, (2) Swing Compressors, (1) Low Temperature Pump Package (LTPR) with (2) Ammonia Pumps and (1) Oil Pot, (1) High Temperature Pump Package (HTPR) with (2) Ammonia Pumps and (1) Oil Pot, (3) Spiral Freezers, (2) Glycol Chillers, (1) Glycol Heat Exchanger, (3) Evaporative Condensers, (1) Auto Purger, and (1) Thermosyphon Receiver and associated piping/valves.

IV.	Hazard Assessment - Worse Case Scenarios (WCS)
Appendix A consists of the RMP*Submit Printout and contains additional information on the worst-case scenario.  Appendix B consists of the offsite consequence analysis data and maps for the worse case release scenario.

ix C consists of the offsite consequence analysis data and maps for the alternative release scenario. 

VI.	General Accidental Release Prevention Program
A prevention program is in place to minimize the risk of hazardous chemical releases in accordance with the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR 1910.119) and the EPA Risk Management Program.   However, as discussed throughout this document Rana Meal Solutions, LLC is continuously improving this program.


 
This prevention program covers those processes that handle ammonia above the threshold quantity for both PSM and RMP rules. The first audit of the PSM program will be conducted on or before April 5, 2022, in compliance with the requirement to conduct PSM audits every three years.  The elements of the PSM / Program 3 prevention program and a brief description are listed below.
¿	Employee Participation - Rana Meal Solutions, LLC has developed a site-specific employee participation plan that ensures employees and their representatives are consulted when conducting and developing process hazard analyses and other information required to be developed under the PSM/RMP regulation.  In addition, the employee participation program will ensure employees and their representatives have access to process hazard analyses and all other information required to be developed under PSM/RMP.  
¿	Process Safety Information - Rana Meal Solutions, LLC maintains a site-specific PSI program that ensures information pertaining to the hazards, technology, and equipment of the process are properly developed and maintained. Process safety information for the ammonia process has been compiled on April 2, 2019.
¿	Process Hazard Analysis - Rana Meal Solutions, LLC has developed a site-specific PHA program that ensures a PHA is conducted initially, at a minimum of every five (5) years, and whenever a change is significant enough to require a change in PSI.  In addition, this program ensures PHAs are conducted in acc

ordance with OSHA and EPA regulations and ensures findings and recommendations of PHAs are properly documented. Rana Meal Solutions, LLC conducted a thorough, initial, PHA study for the refrigeration system on March 12-13, 2019. Continuous improvement in safety is an important goal of Rana Meal Solutions, LLC, which includes follow-up on all recommendations resulting from the PHA.  
¿	Operating Procedures - Rana Meal Solutions, LLC has developed a site-specific procedure that ensures operating procedures provide clear instruction for different phases of process operations and ensures they are properly maintained.  Rana Meal Solutions, LLC developed standard operating procedures for the refrigeration system on March 13-14, 2019.  Annually, the operating procedures will be reviewed and certified as accurate.
¿	Training - Rana Meal Solutions, LLC has developed a site-specific training procedure that ensures employees operating the ammonia process have the knowledge to safely operate the process, are aware of the potential hazards of the process, and understand the causes of process problems.
¿	Management of Change - Rana Meal Solutions, LLC has developed a site-specific management of change procedure that ensures changes (except for replacement in kind) to the ammonia process, such as additions of new equipment or changes in operating, maintenance, or other procedures are documented. 
 
¿	Pre-Startup Review - Rana Meal Solutions, LLC has developed a site-specific pre-startup safety review procedure that ensures a safety review is performed when modifications to the ammonia process are significant enough to require a change in PSI.
¿	Mechanical Integrity - Rana Meal Solutions, LLC has developed a site-specific mechanical integrity procedure that ensures written preventative maintenance procedures are developed and maintained, preventative maintenance tests and inspections are properly documented, and employees maintaining the process receive adequate training.  Ra

na Meal Solutions, LLC formalized maintenance procedures for the refrigeration system during March 2019.
¿	Contractor Qualifications - Rana Meal Solutions, LLC has developed a site-specific contractor qualification procedure that ensures all contract employers' safety performance and programs are evaluated, a contract employee injury and illness log is maintained, information of potential hazards are communicated between Rana Meal Solutions, LLC and the contract employer, and required training and information is communicated, such as the provisions of the emergency response plan and control over entrance into process areas.
¿	Incident Investigation - Rana Meal Solutions, LLC has developed a site-specific incident investigation procedure that ensures each incident that either results in a release or could have resulted in a release of anhydrous ammonia is investigated, within 48 hours, by a team of at least one person knowledgeable in the process.  This procedure will also make provisions to ensure a report is prepared at the conclusion of the investigation and findings are promptly addressed. 
¿	Compliance Audit - Rana Meal Solutions, LLC has developed a site-specific compliance audit program that ensures compliance audits are conducted at a minimum of every three years to verify that Rana Meal Solutions, LLC PSM/RMP practices and procedures are adequate and are being followed.  The initial compliance audit will be completed no later than April 5, 2022.  
¿	Hot Work Permits - Rana Meal Solutions, LLC has updated a best management practice for hot work.  

VII.	Five-Year Accident History
As this is the initial risk management plan (RMP) submittal, for a new facility, the Rana Meal Solutions, LLC facility has not experienced an accidental anhydrous ammonia release, which resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage onsite, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.
 

VIII.	E

mergency Action Program
Rana Meal Solutions, LLC has developed an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) to ensure that in the event of an emergency the facility personnel are aware of the appropriate actions to take and authorities to contact in order to mitigate the effects of a release. 

Rana Meal Solutions, LLC has coordinated their EAP with the Bartlett Fire Department.  This coordination effort includes providing the agency with a copy of our EAP, and providing a site diagram and hazardous material information, meeting with the Bartlett Fire Department personnel to discuss the facilities operations/processes, and encouraging periodic on-site inspections and coordination with Bartlett Fire Department personnel.

Rana Meal Solutions, LLC employees will be responsible for investigating and assisting the Bartlett Fire Department (if necessary) with response to accidental releases of ammonia. 

The current Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for anhydrous ammonia is included in Appendix D. 

IX.	Emergency Communications
The telephone numbers of agencies and plant personnel that may be contacted in case of an emergency are available onsite.

X.	Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Chemical safety is an important part of Rana Meal Solutions, LLC operations. Rana Meal Solutions, LLC is currently implementing their Process Safety Management Program. Continuous improvement in safety is an important goal for Rana Meal Solutions, LLC  

XI.	Management Program
Rana Meal Solutions, LLC has updated a management system to oversee the implementation of the risk management program elements.  This system has assigned qualified person(s) (or position) to assist in the development, implementation, and integration of the risk management program elements.  If any portion of the program is delegated to others, the names or positions of those individuals will be documented and the lines of authority defined through an organization chart or similar document.  Currently, Al Pioch, Environmental
Health and Safety Manager, is responsible for implementation of the overall Risk Management Program.
